greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of ways to represent the n-th prime as arithmetic mean of three other primes.
comment: Differs from A071704: for n>1, if 3*prime(n)-4 is prime then a(n)=1+A071704(n), otherwise a(n)=A071704(n).
link: Zak Seidov and Charles R Greathouse IV, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000 (first 1000 terms from Seidov)
example: a(5)=6 as A000040(5)=11 and  11 has 6 representations  as arithmetic mean of three other (not equal to 11) primes:
program: (PARI) a(n,p=prime(n))=my(s=0); forprime(q=p+2,3*p-4, my(t=3*p-q); forprime(r=max(t-q, 2),(3*p-q)\2, if(t!=p+r && isprime(t-r), s++))); s \\ _Charles R Greathouse IV_, Jun 04 2015
results.author: _Zak Seidov_, May 24 2015
